intro: Satureja georgiana, commonly known as Georgian thyme, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, gray-green leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple, forming compact clusters at the ends of the branches. Satureja georgiana is valued for its fragrant foliage, which is used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb.
